Description: Ostracon, fragment from the body of a brown pottery ribbed vessel, fabric is brown-black in section, interior spotted with a black-resinous deposit, exterior covered with a red/brown slip and faint traces of five lines of Coptic text written in black ink, containing an invoice.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.149)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (87669) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/87669)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 189 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
